name: Premier Inn Bournemouth Central

reviews.text: Worked and stayed in many hotels in bournemouth over 25 years...this was our third stay at Premiere Inn central, in comparison to many hotels it offers an excellent stay, BRILL!
reviews.title: Gets better every year
Excellent - fantastic location, great value!!
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night - had a fantastic room with balcony and sea views. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Location of hotel was great - in the centre of the town just a 5 minute walk to the beach and across the road from a lovely park.
Hotel was spotless. Breakfast was lovely - help yourself buffet - with veggie sausages available on request (which you don't normally get at large hotels!).
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Really quiet at night and if not you get your money back!! Had previously stayed at similar hotel where we were on 1st floor with wedding party/disco going on directly underneath us - all staff would say was "sorry"!
reviews.title: Excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Endorsement of previous reviewers experiences

reviews.text: We went to this hotel because it was recommended by this website. It is in a great location and we parked behind the hotel in the carpark which has access to the hotel inside of the carpark. The staff were extremely polite and helpfull. Our room was huge and clean and the bathroom was big, well lit and clean. The decor of the hotel is very nice. Premier Inn have excelled with this hotel, we would recommend it to anyone and will be going back there very soon, it was so nice to just walk to the beach without getting the car and finding a parking space etc. It was all on the doorstep.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: My only complaint would be the length of time we had to wait for our food in the restaurant. However when it came it was delicious. Lucky we didn't have a theatre reservation or we would not have made it!! Plus the children were getting fidgety!! 2 hours in a restaurant, not good!!
reviews.title: Efficiency at its best..........

reviews.text: All in all a brilliant hotel and a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.text: Thank you Premier Inn Central, Bournemouth for looking after us so well this weekend. A special thank you to the lovely Chloe in the restaurant, she's an absolute asset to your hotel (I hope she does actually go home and have a sleep, she seems to be there all the time!). Lovely clean, quiet room, exceptionally friendly service from staff and sooooo efficient. I asked for more pillows, they were there in seconds, I asked whether we could change our daughter's put-me-up bed (a bit lumpy) and it was sorted within 5 minutes - brilliant.
reviews.title: What a fantastic holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fantastic location, couldn't be better. I guess my slight moan is the restaurant food takes ages to come. We booked evening supper on Thursday for 7.15 p.m. and left at 10 p.m. which usually is fine, but we have small children, so they were getting rather restless. The restaurant food is ok, nothing to write home about, the brushetta with prawns I suggest you take off the menu, it's rubbish and the surf and turf my husband said was tasteless! Apart from the restaurant evening meals being average, the place is brilliant.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first stay in a Premier Inn. They were extremely helpful and polite, the service included a text the day before to ensure we had the correct directions. The hotel is minutes from the beach and overlooks the gardens. The public areas are clean and well kept, as are the rooms. If you want a quiet room ask for the 'short' wing which only has two rooms. We did this but forfeited the chance of a room with a view. The room was quite small but well presented ( although the TV was on the side wall- giving me a crick in the neck)The Manhattan bar in the lobby was closed throughout our stay, with no explanation but this is not a problem as there plently of bars and restaurants in the area. The attached carpark has very small bays and two way traffic, so be aware that this may be an issue. best to leave your car there and use buses and taxis as the hotel advises. Overall a very pleasant experience for a reasonable high season cost.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent a long weekend here for the Air Festival and have already booked for next year at this same hotel. We could not fault any part of our stay here, staff were friendly and very very helpful, our room was clean and very comfortable, everything worked. We had only booked breakfasts which were tasty, plentiful and very well cooked. Location for all the events, cinemas, bars and BIC was very convenient. I would definately recommend this hotel for value and satisfaction. I only wish you could book a balcony room ...to watch the air display when it rains!!! but it's first come first serve.
reviews.title: This hotel was first class and would recommend a stay here

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night for a business trip and was very impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Premier Inns are usually modern purpose built buildings just on the outskirts of somewhere or other but this one is quite different. It’s clearly a conversion from whatever it was before and has a nice art décor feel about it. Reception was very friendly and efficient and the lifts up to the rooms were plentiful and quick too.
reviews.title: as good as some five star hotels

reviews.text: The room itself was very modern decorated in muted tones, flat screen TV, comfortable bed, tea & coffee facilities and a very nice bathroom.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked the hotel for my birthday weekend and what a surprise it was! He had asked for a sea view room when booking and we were given a fantastic family size accommodation with a huge balcony. The view was fabulous and we were directly opposite the pavilion! The rooms were spotlessly clean and the service was great as the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is great and the shopping centre is only a five minute walk away. We will definitely be returning and I hope it's soon!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel with fantastic views!

reviews.text: We went to the Premier inn having stayed there a few times
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We had a family room (2 seperate bedrooms) and were on the 8th floor on the corner overlooking the sea and the gardens.It was the best room we have ever stayed in for views and size.It also had a huge balcony but unfortunatley we couldnt access it as the doors were locked as no partitions have been put in place on the balcony
reviews.title: Premier Inn At Its Best, Shame About The Reception team!

reviews.text: The breakfast was superb and the staff excellent
reviews.title: No sophistication, simple and I will stay again........

reviews.text: There was only one small problem and that is a nasty smell as you enter the reception and it was also there when we went last time
reviews.title: Very good value - hard to fault.

description: This magnificent art deco hotel is a stone's throw away from the sea front. Local to major transport links (road, rail, bus and air). Walking distance to: 7 miles of award-winning beaches, Bournemouth town centre, Pavilion, Pier, B.I.C, Gardens and great night life.Our Bournemouth Central Premier Inn has everything you'd expect, incredibly comfy beds in every room and an integrated restaurant serving a mix of traditional and contemporary dishes.
